settings.name: Prepare classification parameters or run classification
settings.description: Choose if an input form with classification parameters should be prepared, or the form is ready for classification. The input form with default settings needs to be reviewed. Note that the input form is not used for clasification of single individual tracking data – then set the parameters below.

options.displayText: The form is ready to upload (or not needed in case of a single-individual data set). Run classification of the tracking data.

settings.name: Capture status of a bird
settings.description: Capture status of a bird during tagging. ‘winter’ when tagged on the wintering grounds, ‘breed’ when tagged on the breeding grounds. Birds tagged at stopover sites should be assigned to ‘winter’ if the location is closer to wintering grounds, and ‘breed’ if closer to breeding grounds. Alternatively, nest coordinates can be supplied.

settings.name: Nest coordinates
settings.description: Nest coordinates (longitude, latitude) supplied in decimal format and WGS84 coordinate system, for instance c(Long = 2.3593, Lat = 48.8415). Alternatively, capture status of a bird during tagging can be provided.

settings.name: Merge single-row blocks
settings.description: Merge single-row blocks of migration or stationary records with the neighbouring blocks.

settings.name: Ground speed
settings.description: Use the ground speed measured by GPS instead of the speed between consecutive records.

settings.name: Bursts in the records
settings.description: Preserve bursts in the data, i.e. very frequent records.

settings.name: Maximum reasonable speed of flight
settings.description: Set the highest reasonable speed of bird flight (m/s). The value may be a bit larger than the highest know speed of flight of a given bird species to preserve exceptional but real fast flights. Default value is 40 m/s.

settings.name: Distance gap between consecutive stationary records
settings.description: Set the limit distance (km) between two consecutive stationary records above which the records will be split into two block. Default value is 30 km.

settings.name: Time gap between consecutive stationary records
settings.description: Set the limit time (hours) between two consecutive stationary records above which the records will be split into two block. Default value is 3 hours.

settings.name: Distance for distinguishing breeding from wintering grounds.
settings.description: Set the limit distance (km) below which breeding and wintering grounds are not separated from each other, i.e. the bird did not migrate. Default value is 50 km.

settings.name: Distance between near (neighbouring) blocks.
settings.description: Distance (km) below which two near (neighbouring) blocks of stationary records are merged. Default value is 20 km.

settings.name: Distance for detection of ‘outlier’ records in stopover blocks.
settings.description: Distance (km) above which the neighbouring records in a stopover block are considered ‘outliers’ and reclassified as migratory records. Default value is 1 km.

settings.name: Minimum number of records in a stopover block.
settings.description: Minimum number of records in a stopover block to be checked for ‘outliers’. Default value is 2.

settings.name: Distance for detection of new stationary blocks.
settings.description: Distance (km) above which the neighbouring records in a stationary block are assigned to a new block. Default value is 5 km.

settings.name: Minimum length of a breeding or wintering block.
settings.description: Minimum length (days) of a block of records to be recognized as breeding or wintering grounds. Default value is 30 days.

settings.name: Input form with parameter settings for each individual.
settings.description: Please upload a single csv file if data on multiple individuals will be classified.
